SEARCH
Package model

Class GameSession

java.lang.Object
model.GameSession
public class GameSession extends Object
Represents an active game session between two players. Manages the game state, card decks, hands, and game flow.

  • Constructor Summary

    GameSession(String matchId, Player p1, Player p2, List<Card> deckP1, List<Card> deckP2, GameFacade facade)
    Constructs a new game session between two players.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameSession

      public GameSession(String matchId, Player p1, Player p2, List<Card> deckP1, List<Card> deckP2, GameFacade facade)
      Constructs a new game session between two players.
      Parameters:
      matchId - the unique identifier for this match
      p1 - the first player
      p2 - the second player
      deckP1 - the deck of cards for player 1
      deckP2 - the deck of cards for player 2
      facade - the game facade for communication

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game session by shuffling decks and dealing initial cards.

    • drawCards

      public void drawCards(String playerId, int count)
      Draws cards from the player's deck into their hand.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the ID of the player drawing cards
      count - the number of cards to draw

    • playCard

      public boolean playCard(String playerId, String cardId)
      Plays a card from the player's hand. Enforces a global cooldown to prevent spamming actions.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the ID of the player playing the card
      cardId - the ID of the card to play
      Returns:
      true if the card was played successfully, false otherwise

    • resolveActions

      public void resolveActions()
      Resolves all pending actions for the current turn. Executes card effects and checks for game end conditions.

    • getPlayer1

      public Player getPlayer1()
      Gets the first player in this session.
      Returns:
      the first player

      Gets the second player in this session.
      Returns:
      the second player

    • getHandP1

      Gets the hand of the first player.
      Returns:
      the first player's hand

    • getHandP2

      public List<Card> getHandP2()
      Gets the hand of the second player.

      the second player's hand

      Gets the current turn number.
